result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Kay Bunyea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent in each Count.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 23, 2015 by 10:30 a.m.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF44.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF44.

-Follow Dr. Molar's recommendations for therapy for minor children and self.
-Any other Evaluations.
-Anger Management Assessment if requested within 30 days.
-Complete current treatment with Ms. Stevenson.
-Contact Family Resource Center and UW-Extension and complete Parenting Program.
-Participate in Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Participate in Victim Empathy Seminar if requested by Agent.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT with M.P.D. dob 5/18/2002.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with her own children.
-Maintain Mental Health Treatment and take all medications as prescribed.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA if not already completed within 30 days and follow all recommended treatment.

c: Def & Atty. eif
Probation review hearing at 01-25-2016 04:00 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Melissa Kay Bunyea appeared. GAL Atty. Thomas Dahle appears in 15CF44. Originally set for Status Conference. Includes 15CF228 and 15CF44. Case called at 9:18 am. Atty. Caton updates Court, there is an agreement. Plea Questionnaire is filed. ADA Correll recites agreement, Ct. 1 and Ct.2 in 15CF44 amended to misdemeanor battery battery per WI Stat 940.19(1). ADA Correll will filed Amended Information. GAL Dahle requests conditions.  Crt reviews Plea Quest /Waiver of Rights and State's burden of proof w/ DF. DF pleads Guilty to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 amended misdemeanor battery charges in 15CF44. Crt finds DF waives constitutional rights and enters plea freely, knowingly and voluntarily. Court finds DF guilty. Both ADA and Atty stipulate to facts that support the charge DF has pled to. Court dismisses charge in 15CF228. ADA Correll gives sentencing arguments. Atty. Caton responds and files reports. DF makes statement to Court. GAL provides recommendation. 

Court Orders in 15CF44: SENT W/H, 2 years probation, concurrent in each count. With conditions:
-90 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED, huber is granted for employment and AODA
-AODA, if not already completed, within 30 days, comply with recommended treatment
-Follow Dr Molar recommendations for therapy for minor children and self 
-Any other evaluations/anger management requested must be completed within 30 days
-Complete current treatment with Ms. Stevenson
-Contact Family Resource Center and UW-Extension and complete Parenting Program
-DNA surcharge for Ct. 1
-Court costs for Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, apply bond on file and payable through probation
-Participate in restorative justice program if requested by victim and participate in victim empathy seminar if requested by supervising agent.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's
-No possession of firearms
-NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT  with M.P.D. dob 5/18/2002.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT with her own children. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
-Maintain mental health treatment and take all medications as prescribed
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Follow all rules and regulations and pay supervision fees
-Report to probation by 10:30 am 10/23/15
Probation review hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Status conference at 10-23-2015 09:00 am

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Melissa Kay Bunyea appeared. GAL Dahle also present. Includes 15CF44 and 15CF228. Case called at 4:40 pm. Plea hearing at 10-06-2015 04:00 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Melissa Kay Bunyea appeared. GAL Dahle also present. 15CF44 and 15CF228. Case called at 3:07 pm. Atty Caton requests more time. No objection from ADA Correll. Address confirmed. GAL Dahle makes statement. Bond continues. km  Plea hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 09-22-2015 03:00 pm

-Defendant to test at Croix County Jail for UA & PBT testing every Saturday by 10:00 am, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  J.R.B. dob 5/23/2004.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M.P.D. dob 5/18/2002.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- To to operate a motor vehicle unless system is clean of everything

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
